help_text.rotterdam_criteria: PCOS diagnosis requires meeting at least 2 out of 3 Rotterdam criteria: irregular ovulation, hyperandrogenism, and polycystic ovaries on ultrasound.
help_text.phenotypes: PCOS phenotypes indicate the specific combination of criteria met and help guide treatment approaches.
help_text.gi_index: Glycemic Index (GI) measures how quickly foods raise blood sugar. Low-GI foods (< 55) are recommended for PCOS.
help_text.macro_ratio: The 40-30-30 macro ratio (40% carbs, 30% protein, 30% fat) helps manage insulin sensitivity in PCOS.
help_text.geographic_customization: Meal plans are adapted to use locally available ingredients and culturally appropriate cuisines.
help_text.ultrasound_analysis: AI analyzes ultrasound images to detect polycystic ovarian morphology (12+ follicles, increased volume).
